file_content.text: Hey. Pal. With each passing second we don't get assigned to a ship, our odds of holding Kuat go way, way down.
Kendra, there's a process! You can't just go around demanding things!
Well, I just did, Threegee.
Maybe if you let Kendra get us on a ship, we could all have less talking and more blasting. I been itching to shoot down Imps for weeks!
So you have. Regardless, I can't say I care for your imprecise characterization of the odds.
I would prefer to focus not on the harm we might do to others and their great star-faring machines, but on the good we might do the Republic.
Gimme a break with all the hugs and feelings, Wogawa....
How do you see things, good stranger? Is our ultimate goal to destroy the enemy or to secure galactic peace?
How do you see things, good strangers? Is our ultimate goal to destroy the enemy or to secure galactic peace?
Peace.
We should strive for a day without war.
I can get behind that philosophy.
I fight so that one day we won't have to fight.
Hey, I'm all about kicking back and taking it easy, you know?
Sounds like a plan.
Gotta be kidding me. Anyone got an anti-nausea stim?
To eradicate the Empire.
I say the fewer Imperials in the galaxy, the better.
I won't stop until the Sith Empire's a smoldering husk.
Knew there was something I liked about you.
There can't be peace for the galaxy with the Empire around. They'd never stand for it.
Both.
I concur. Why, in the First Battle of Bothawui, I found the Empire rather savage.
Bothawui again, Threegee? That all you can yap about is your big moment of victory?
Don't ever change, Ashy.
Hey, I'm just saying.
May I say, you're always "just saying." One of us does not quite understand the meaning of that phrase, I'm afraid....
